events.name: AI Hackathon
events.description: The AI Hackathon brings together programmers, data enthusiasts, and creative minds to build innovative artificial intelligence solutions. Expect team-based challenges, mentor guidance, and networking sessions that connect newbies and experts alike.

connection highlights.name: Eva Greene
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Eva studied Chemistry at the B.Sc level and is currently between jobs, with a strong interest in research and some experience handling legal matters under pressure.
connection highlights.whyConnect: She’s well-connected at the hackathon, making her a perfect first contact if you’re looking to meet a variety of participants quickly.

connection highlights.name: Mia Thompson
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Mia has a B.Sc in Microbiology, blending a fascination for technology with a passion for human health. She also excels in leadership, teamwork, and public speaking.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Her perspective on merging biology and tech could lead to fresh AI insights, and she’s well-positioned to make introductions across various teams.

connection highlights.name: Priya Singh
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Another B.Sc in Microbiology grad focusing on technology and healthcare. She’s skilled in design, writing, and teamwork.
connection highlights.whyConnect: She shares Mia’s breadth of connections, so you can bounce interdisciplinary ideas around or simply get introduced to interesting new contacts.

connection highlights.name: Ray Johnson
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A software engineer with a B.Sc in IT, Ray is strong in critical thinking and active listening.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Ray serves as a bridge between tech-focused connection highlights and those from non-technical backgrounds, helping you navigate the hackathon’s diverse crowd.

connection highlights.name: Taylor Chen
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A creative with a diploma in video editing but a keen interest in teaching and entrepreneurship.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Taylor can help you explore educational angles for AI or connect you with entrepreneurial teams looking to commercialize their hackathon projects.

events.name: Tech Symposium 2025
events.description: The Tech Symposium is a yearly gathering of innovators, entrepreneurs, and researchers showcasing the latest in technology. Panel discussions, product demos, and hands-on workshops offer connection highlights a glimpse into cutting-edge developments across various fields.

connection highlights.name: Josie Gardner
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A B.Sc Mathematics student currently between jobs, Josie is interested in news coverage and has strong communication and leadership skills.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Josie’s social nature helps her link you to top conversations and influential figures quickly—ideal if you’re trying to meet a range of people.

connection highlights.name: Sophia Martin
connection highlights.cheatsheet: An Assistant Manager with a B.Sc in Biotechnology, Sophia excels at merging research, marketing, and people management.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Sophia can show you how to blend scientific insights with business strategy, giving you a leg up on commercializing your tech ideas.

connection highlights.name: Elena Park
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Another Assistant Manager with a B.Sc in Biotechnology, Elena has overlapping leadership and communication skills.
connection highlights.whyConnect: She’s influential in biotech circles and a valuable resource if you need deeper industry contacts or guidance in scientific ventures.

connection highlights.name: Natalie Carter
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Like Sophia and Elena, Natalie is an Assistant Manager with a biotech background, adept at turning theory into practice.
connection highlights.whyConnect: She’s part of the 'Science/Manager' group—perfect for introductions to people at the forefront of tech-business collaborations.

connection highlights.name: Carmen Alvarez
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A B.Sc Mathematics student with ambitions to teach, Carmen also shows strong leadership and communication skills.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Carmen’s focus on education makes her a great ally for anyone looking to improve training programs or academic outreach in the tech space.

events.name: Annual Blockchain Workshop 2025
events.description: Focused on decentralization and distributed ledger technology, the Blockchain Workshop dives into real-world use cases, from supply chain management to crypto-finance. connection highlights can join hands-on demos, keynote talks, and group discussions.

connection highlights.name: Kelsey White
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A biotech student who’s into research, entrepreneurship, and technology; excels at analytical and problem-solving tasks.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Kelsey’s all-round curiosity about blockchain, biotech, and startups makes her a fantastic partner for cross-industry brainstorming.

connection highlights.name: Sydney Brooks
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A B.Sc Mathematics graduate passionate about media coverage, with strong leadership and problem-solving skills.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Sydney can offer insights into how blockchain is perceived publicly and help brainstorm ways to engage mainstream audiences.

connection highlights.name: Amara Collins
connection highlights.cheatsheet: An Assistant Manager with a B.Sc in Biotechnology, adept at blending scientific knowledge with business acumen.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Amara can guide you on integrating blockchain solutions into biotech processes, bridging lab research and commercial reality.

connection highlights.name: Devin Ward
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A lecturer with a background in Electronics and Communication, specializing in data analytics and programming.
connection highlights.whyConnect: If you want a deeper dive into the technical layers of blockchain—especially data analytics—Devin is your go-to mentor for clarity and guidance.

connection highlights.name: Omar Patel
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A Design Engineer combining chemistry expertise with a passion for research, teaching, and tech.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Omar has an engineer’s perspective on blockchain innovation—talk to him for fresh ideas on product design or workflow improvements.

connection highlights.name: Marisa Phillips
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Another Assistant Manager from a biotech background, mirroring many of Amara’s business and communication skills.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Marisa has a comparable biotech–blockchain focus, offering more opportunities to expand your network in this niche space.

Event Time Line.activity: Breakout Sessions: Supply Chain, Healthcare, Fintech
Roundtable Discussion: Future of Blockchain Regulation

events.name: Healthcare Meetup 2025
events.description: This meetup gathers healthcare professionals, tech developers, and policy advocates keen on innovating the medical sector. Workshops, breakout sessions, and networking help participants discover cutting-edge solutions to modern healthcare challenges.

connection highlights.name: Dana Sinclair
connection highlights.cheatsheet: An Assistant Manager with a B.Sc in Biotechnology, covering research, marketing, and teaching interests.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Dana acts as a central connector—she knows most of the major healthcare players, ensuring you can quickly find the specialists you need.

connection highlights.name: Declan Hughes
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A B.Sc in Statistics who works as an Assistant System Engineer, exploring finance, machine learning, and social causes.
connection highlights.whyConnect: He’s your best bet if you want to brainstorm data-heavy healthcare solutions, whether that’s predictive analytics or streamlining hospital logistics.

connection highlights.name: Eva Ruiz
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A math student currently unemployed, but strongly interested in news coverage and skilled in communication.
connection highlights.whyConnect: She bridges the gap between healthcare topics and media outreach; perfect if you need advice on how to promote or explain complex health innovations.

connection highlights.name: Cole Davis
connection highlights.cheatsheet: A Sub Editor with a background in Physics, focusing on news coverage and social justice.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Cole’s editorial lens helps you frame healthcare breakthroughs in ways the public can appreciate, ensuring your message is clear and impactful.

connection highlights.name: Jonah Mitchell
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Another Sub Editor (Physics grad) driven by social justice and content creation.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Jonah can help you refine how you communicate health issues, whether it’s for the public or for institutional stakeholders.

connection highlights.name: Avery Price
connection highlights.cheatsheet: Also a Sub Editor with physics roots, sharing interests in news and creative content.
connection highlights.whyConnect: Avery completes the editorial trio, giving you multiple avenues to shape and share your healthcare stories effectively.

Event Time Line.activity: Breakout Sessions (AI in Healthcare, Policy & Ethics)
Panel Discussion: Future of Healthcare Communication
